item.title: Upgrading to R at RStudio::conf(2019)
item.description: A few months ago, I was beyond thrilled to be chosen to give an e-poster at RStudio::conf(2019) on the topic of Upgrading to R. I had such a blast talking to people who are trying to get their team to use more R, sharing some of the lessons I’ve learned over the last few years. My slides are available online, but I’d also like to share some of the things I spoke with people about, and a little on how I made the slides.

item.title: A Shareable R Workflow
item.description: If you, like me, work primarily in R, I bet you’ve pulled a colleague’s scripts, tried to load the data and, File Not Found Error. Argh!! Thanks to Jenny Bryan’s awesome blog post, I learned there’s a better solution that’s already made me overhaul my sharing workflow. Thanks to the combination of RStudio Projects in RStudio and the here package, my woes with manually setting directories are over. For a while, I’ve been using RStudio Projects since they’re a great way to keep work on different projects distinct.

item.title: Fonts in ggplot2 on Windows and Mac
item.description: A lot of things are great and easy to do in ggplot2…but putting new fonts in can be a pain in the butt. I had to do this last week, so I decided to write down what I did (as much for me as for anyone else). Get the package extrafont: install.packages('extrafont') Start extrafont: library(extrafont) Import system fonts to R (this can take a minute): font_import() Load fonts: loadfonts(device = 'win').
